item.title: Scraping Javascript page using Python
item.description: Python library dryscape can be used to scrape javascript driven websites. Code To give an example, I created a sample page with following HTML code. (link): <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <meta charset="utf-8"> <title>Javascript scraping test</title> </head> <body> <p id='intro-text'>No javascript support</p> <script> document.getElementById('intro-text').innerHTML = 'Yay! Supports javascript'; </script> </body> </html> without javascript it says: No javascript support and with javascript: Yay! Supports javascript Scraping without JS support: >>> import requests >>> from bs4 import BeautifulSoup >>> response = requests.
